intro: Chenopodium serotinum, commonly known as late goosefoot, is an annual herbaceous plant native to North America. It typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is characterized by its succulent, lobed leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers in clusters, and its seeds are dispersed by wind. Chenopodium serotinum has a shallow root system and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes other plants known for their nutritional value and adaptability.
